name: B.S., Public Health
prog-reqq-blob: and MATH 103L Mathematics for Business Laboratory (1)
MATH 141/L Essentials of Statistics and Lab (3/1)
and BIOL 212 Laboratory Studies in Human Anatomy (1)
BIOL 213 Human Anatomy for Health Sciences (3)
and BIOL 218L Microbes and People Lab (1)
BIOL 375 Emerging Issues in Regenerative Medicine (3)
4. Upper Division Health Sciences Department Core (7 units)
5. Required Public Health Core Courses (36 units)
EOH 353 Global Perspectives of Environmental Health (3)
HSCI 314 Organization and Delivery of Health Services (3)
HSCI 331 Principles and Foundations of Health Education (3)
HSCI 391 Computer Applications in Health Sciences (3)
HSCI 437 Effective Strategies and Methods for Public Health Practice (3)
HSCI 445 Program Evaluation for Health Education (3)
HSCI 494PH Academic Internship for Public Health (2)
HSCI 494IPH Academic Internship Evaluation in Public Health (1)
Select up to 12 units from the following, with Public Health advisor approval:
HSCI 336 Health Aspects of Drug Use (3)
HSCI 434 Lactation Education: Prenatal and Perinatal Period (3)
HSCI 435 Health Science for Children and Youth (3)
Undergraduate students must complete 48 units of General Education as described in this Catalog, including 3 units of coursework meeting the Ethnic Studies (ES) graduation requirement.

21 units are satisfied by the following courses in the major: CHEM 100 or CHEM 103 satisfies B1 Physical Science; BIOL 101 satisfies B2 Life Science; BIOL 101L satisfies B3 Science Laboratory Activity; MATH 102 or MATH 103 or MATH 140 or MATH 140BUS or MATH 140SCI or MATH 141/L satisfies Basic Skills B4 Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning; EOH 353 satisfies B5 Scientific Inquiry and Quantitative Reasoning; PSY 150 and HSCI 345 satisfy D1 Social Sciences; and ENGL 306 satisfies E Lifelong Learning.
Total Units Required for the B.S. Degree: 120
